alert.note: Alert for Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 21 at 11:40AM CST until February 21 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Wilkin County. In North Dakota, Ransom, Sargent and Richland Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 9 PM to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snowfall will continue after blizzard conditions leading to further travel impacts.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
